notes: S2000 seats are legendary for support and style. They physically fit in Civics and Integras, but the rails are different. You need to swap the S2000 seat pans onto your Civic/Integra rails (requires drilling spot welds) or buy aftermarket conversion rails.

partName: Subaru WRX / STi Seats in Forester
notes: Front seats from a 'Bugeye', 'Blobeye', or 'Hawkeye' WRX/STi bolt directly into the SF and SG Forester. Massive upgrade in bolstering over the flat Forester seats. The rear seats do NOT swap directly (sedan vs wagon).

Seats from 94-04 Mustangs bolt directly onto the seat tracks of 79-93 Fox Bodies. This is the most common interior upgrade for Fox owners, getting rid of the flat, worn-out original seats for the more supportive SN95 buckets.
NB Miata seats bolt directly into the older NA Miata. They are more comfortable and have higher headrests. RX-8 seats can also be fitted to NC Miatas with some rail modification.

partName: BMW E46 Sport Seats in E36
notes: E46 seats can be fitted to E36s. The bolt pattern on the rails is slightly different (requires elongating the rear holes on the rails). Wiring for power/heat requires splicing connectors. A great way to get modern comfort in an E36.

partName: Nissan S15 / R32 / R33 Seats in S13/S14
notes: Nissan sports car seats from the 90s are highly interchangeable. S15 seats bolt into S13/S14s (sometimes requiring swapping one mounting foot). R32/R33 GTR seats are a premium upgrade and fit with minor rail modifications.

partName: VW Golf Mk4 / Audi TT / A3 Interior Swap
notes: Front seats interchange between these platform mates. Audi TT seats in a Golf Mk4 is a classic upgrade. Steering wheels also interchange (check airbag connector types). TT pedals (aluminum) fit Golfs.
